content.detailedDescription: Around 21:00 on march 29th, 2010, i took my two dogs out to do thier business before bed. as always i looked up to see whats going on in the sky. i saw the usual air traffic from dfw coiming and going. i did see somthing heading east that caught my eye. i saw a flash at first i thought it was another plane and it's faa lights blinking off and on, but as i watched the object contunue to move to the east it split into two craft and went into different directions. one object went north and the other stayed on it's original path. the object heading north moved in an eratic pattern until i lost it in the haze. the second object move in steady pattern. the two objects were identical in size, shape and color. the shape was hard to determine due to the lack of light but if i had to guess it would be circiular. the weather was clear, breezy and hazy. the moon was out but not emitting alot of light. i see planes flying in the sky all the time coming and going to all the airports around the metroplex, but i've never seen anything like this before.
content.summary: Flash - red light object split into 2 and both went into different directions

content.detailedDescription:
Last night, as i drove to a friend's house, i noticed three very bright objects, very low in the sky. at first glance, i thought they were just stars. as i turned onto the road that goes to my friend's house, i realized that not only were the objects far too big, bright and low to be stars, but they were aligned in an almost straight line, sort of like orion's belt. they were at an angle, approximately 20 degrees, and the left side was the lowest point.

i parked in my friend's driveway, got out of my truck, looked for where the objects were in relation to the house, and decided that the lights were definitely not on the mountain (like car headlights coming down from the ski basin.) i looked around in the sky and noticed that there were no other stars visible. it was sort of cloudy all evening.

i called my friend on the phone to tell him to come outside right away. (and actually another friend was visiting, too, so they both came outside.) i didn't want to take my eyes off of the objects, just in case they moved or did something interesting.

my friends came outside and i pointed them in the right direction. i asked them what they thought the objects were. my one friend said immediately that she thought they were ufos, and the other friend asked if they might be helicopters. 

we watched the objects for a good 10 minutes. they did not move at all.

the strange part, in my opinion, is that it seemed like the more we talked about them, the dimmer they got. and they faded out, one by one. the one of the far left end went dim first. as it went out, the next one got dim, then disappeared. the third object/light, on the right end, didn't fade out immediately. we stood there watching it until it eventually disappeared, like the light switch was simply flipped to 'off.' and i mean it disappeared instead of going dim.

from the time i noticed the objects to the time the third one finally disappeared, no more than fifteen minutes elapsed.

during this "sighting", after the first object disappeared from view, my female friend and i jokingly talked about how they knew we were watching them. i wasn't exactly joking, though. i had the distinct feeling that the objects were aware of our awareness of them. and i felt like the third object "chose" to stay in view for a little while longer to make a point.  yes, as ridiculous as that seems.

and yes, it occurred to me that it is april fool's day, but i am indeed telling the truth.
content.summary: Three star-like objects in formation.

content.detailedDescription: We live up agaist a golf corse and i let the dog out in the evening and take time to look up at the stars.  i observed a star-like object, roughtly 60 odd degrees (estimation)in the sky, moving in a southeasterly direction.  steady speed and in a straight trajectory.  a white light color.  no contrail and definitly not meteorite. i tracked the object for about a minute and then it faded out to black.  i assume that it was catching sunlight until it moved into the shadow of the earth.  it appeared to be at great altitude.  secondly, an object that catches sunlight at 10:30 pm in central kentucky must be at extreme altitude.  do satelites move in a southeasterly direction? absolutely no aircraft marker lights.  speed was much faster that commercial aircraft.  iss is over central africa.  anyone's thoughts would be welcome.
content.summary: Moving star-like object

content.detailedDescription:
My mom got home from work at ut hospital about 10:30 last night and there was a hitchhiker walking right by our house as she pulled in the driveway, and he asked her for a ride. he said he was going home and he lived near johnny martin's (not his real name but we'll call him johnny)house. i know johnny, but mom doesn't so she said she didn't know how to get there and she was extremely sleepy because she had only gotten about 45 minutes of sleep the night before, then had to go work another 12 hour shift. she politely declined his request to be driven home. 

as she came in the door, she told my family about him and how it's unusual to see a hitchhiker on our road. she told me where he lived and i said i knew johnny. she said he had told her that he had been walking since newport (about 30 miles) and was extremely tired, so i went with her to keep her safe and we gave him a ride (she didn't want to go alone for fear of him robbing her or harming her). 

we took him home and he showed us around for about an hour. as we walked out his door, i looked toward the southeast horizon and saw a baby-blue (almost white) light that at first i thought was a star. i immediately realized it was moving and thought "that must be an airplane." i judged its distance by observing its speed relative to distance and determined it to be about 2000 feet away. it soon went so low that it went below the treetops. i thought nothing of it then. it was not until much later after we had gotten home that i realize the way that object was flying was not like an airplane, and how could it land when the closest town is still 22 miles away and this thing was only about an estimated 2000 feet away? it was flying in a zig-zag pattern which is very unusual and i realized later that it was also completely silent. at a distance of around 2000 feet, any aircraft i know of would be easily heard. i didn't comment on it at the time i saw it since i thought it was just an airplane. 

this could be something easily explainable but i was unable to identify it.
content.summary: Strange silent light seen moving slowly around 11:30 at night

content.detailedDescription: I was leaving a friends house looked up at the sky around sunset to the west and there was a really bright light thougt at first it was the cell tower but the light was to bright the sky was still blue and sun was just setting i looked at for a minute then drove to my brothers house to show him and he already notice it so me and my brothers kid went out and looked at it again for a couple of min went back inside for 5 min and went back out to look at it again and it was gone you could see it at sunset for about an half-hour it look close and low to the gound
content.summary: Look like a really bright  star was not moving

content.detailedDescription:
I remember it being a friday evening, as we always went to the property for the weekend, leaving shortly after i got off work. we were traveling north on county rd. 315 north of ft. mccoy. the road runs through thousands of acres of lumber company woodlands.

there was no radio in my truck just the sound of the engine and tires on the road. my wife who was with me was fast asleep, as was her custom when things were quiet. 
it was just a few miles north of ft. mccoy, as the road made a very gradual right turn, that this object came to view. it passed me from the right. paralleled the truck briefly then passed on to dissapear in the treetops along the road. i sped up to try to catch it, but abruptly veered more to the right and the trees hid it instantly
  i was traveling around 60 mph. when it passed.  i would estimate it's speed at 80 to 90. the really strange things were the lights and the total lack of sound. one would reasonably expect an object 100ft. or so above you traveling 80-90 mph. to make some type of noise ( a whine or hum of some sort)but nothing but silence came from it. 
 the lights were horizontally attached,(yellow, bright white and green) about in the center of it, spaced about 10 ft. apart for it's full length, which seemed to be 120-30 ft.In all. the diameter of it was 20-25 ft. (using the height of the trees for comparison) the shape resembled a thick stubby cigar.
 each light was mounted on what seem to be a bump. simillar to the headlights on 1940 vehicles in the way that they stick out.

 after the encounter, as i drove on, i thought it could be a blinp of some kind headed to a game or some type of event. as i went through the sighting in my mind, i realized that no blimp could have made an almost instant 90 degree turn as this had. blimps can only (because of their shape) make slow gradual turns.
content.summary: Exterior lighted cigar shaped object passed vehicle at tree top level

content.detailedDescription:
I realize the irony of today being april 1st but i will swear an oath that what i am saying is true and correct.

the weather was so nice this morning that i decided to prop my front door open and have a smoke outside my office this morning. while enjoying my smoke and watching the clouds move rapidly north, i saw a contrail from what i at first thought to be an airplane. looking closer i noticed something wasn't quite right so i grabbed my 10 x 50 binoculars to take a closer look. i observed the contrail moving rapidly and consistently from north to south but there was nothing that i could visibly see that was creating the trail the trail seemed to be appearing out of thin air, there was no aircraft. the event lasted only a few minutes.

there were two separate cloud layers this morning and the event was occurring below the top layer.
content.summary: Invisible

content.detailedDescription: Some time last year my brother took this photograph at the time he did not notice anything unusual in the sky. the other day he was going through all his photo's looking for a sky to put in his painting,(he is a landscape artist) he noticed the two objects in the photo and enlarged them. they appear to be cone shaped. we don't know what they are but thought they may be of interest to you. the view is taken from the top of connor downs in cornwall facing aprox. north. he asked me to send the details to mufon his email is included as well as mine.
content.summary: My brother was out taking  photographs he is a landscape artist and takes lots of photo's of skies to use in his paintings.

content.detailedDescription: Some time last year my brother took this photograph at the time he did not notice anything unusual in the sky. the other day he was going through all his photo's looking for a sky to put in his painting, he noticed the two objects in the photo and enlarged them. they appear to be cone shaped. we don't know what they are but thought they may be of interest to you. the view is taken from the top of connor downs in cornwall facing aprox. north.
content.summary: My brother was out taking  photographs he is a landscape artist and takes lots of photo's of skies to use in his paintings.

content.detailedDescription:
Where i lived at that time there was a small convenience store on the property (rental homes/campground). i was walking home from the store when i saw a large pink, hazy light motionles in the sky. i watched it for a minute or two, then told my son who was in the house to come and see this for himself. we stood there, looking up at it as it moved around the sky, other people who were going to or coming from the store also saw it and joined us on my lawn. there were at one time perhaps 12-15 people watching it. it stayed visible and active for a considerable length of time, i remember even getting tired of standing and sat on the grass watching it while it varied from bright, to dim and back several times and moved sometimes at great speed from point to point (there were no tall structures or trees to obstruct our view, which was an arc of about 80 degrees) and suddenly stop, at other times it would lazily meander to another location only to do it again and again. it also changed colors during this display. a milky white, pale blue, yellow glow. always in pastel type colors possibly due to the light cloud cover overhead. it never came close to the ground, always above the wispy cloud cover, so it's actual height was impossible to judge.
  total time, to the best of my recollection was 1/2 to 3/4 hour. at the end of the display it shot off at incredible speed to the sse at an angle of about 60 degrees upward. covering a huge amount of sky before disapearing.
this sighting is very limited and vague, but it's the bast i can do without lying.


this is the first and worst of three sightings i've experienced in 65 years. the other two were more distinct.

one more item:  whether or not you beleive me doesn't matter. i know what i saw and i'm writing down..Take it or leave it.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering,Other
content.summary: Light in the sky behaving abnormally

content.detailedDescription: While out side i saw coming from the east,two disk shaped objects.These were about the size of a pencil eraser.They were close together.It seemed that they were tilting in the sky.One was reflecting the sun,but,the other was a dull grey they seemed fast.By the time i got my camera i was only able to get a dot in the sky.I had to darken the picture so as to see the object.
content.summary: Two disks side by side coming from the east,then turned nnw .One refected the sun,the other was a dull grey .

content.detailedDescription:
Lights appeared south east of my house in abilene texas...15 or so degress on the horizon putting them in callahan county around hgh 36 somewhere near the pecan bayou or eula area.  i was sitting on my back porch when i first saw them at 8:30 on march 31'st.  first i saw one light...Then two lights...Then 5 lined up in a straight vertical line...The next sighting they were 4 horizontal...Each time they lasted just a few seconds...The whole event was just about minute and 1/2.  i got my wife to see witness them also...She saw up to 3 lights and then went back to her tv show...I told her to bring me some aluminum foil.  i'm 57 years old lived around planes all my life...I can tell you the type of jet plane flying over by the engine noise and sound...I have seen flares, afterburners, lights...These i cannot explain.  they were like little 'm' s or spheres and mostly orange...They had no comet tails...They did not move once they appeared.  they did appear in different locations each time...But not too far from their last appearance. 

what got my attention was a plane was landing at abilene municipal airport when the object appeared behind the plane... i thought the plane might be in trouble and started to call 911 to report it...I watched and the plane went on to land but the lights were still appearing behind the plane...The aircraft landing was a probably a commercial flight coming from dfw.  this is the second time i have seen the lights...First time i just blew it off...Told my wife and she got a good laugh...Not this time.

fort hood is 180 miles southeast of abilene and i'm sure i could not see activity from where my house is...I have seen many dog fights from aircraft around lake brownwoood area but these were not afterburners or flares that are dropped to confuse heat sinking missles...I have seen those before at many air shows...They are like sparklers that drop in altitudes...These would just appear and disapper quickly.
content.summary: Orange lights appeared...Up to 5 ...In straight vertical lines...Then 4 in horizontal lines...Then in circles

content.detailedDescription:
this is a combination of a sighting report and commentary. i hope you will post this as i feel the need to convey this message.
  i made my 1st sighting report in oct. 4, 2008 which was in s.E. indiana after i overheard (later verified) police scanner traffic @ around 9:30pm regarding a blue flash n-ne from my location some 20 mi. perhaps.  i imediately went outside to look and i saw a starlike object traverse the nw skyline for a few moments and turn a pinkish hue and dissapear over the horizon.
  about 2 weeks ago(can't pinpoint exact date around 03/16/10) in the morning hour i observed what appeared 3 (arc welder's) flashes in sequence of 3 in the ne sky. i can only compare this as looking like the sun glinting off a polished airliner or the above mentioned welder's arc. not sure what it was, there was a jet in the air towards the nw and that's what i was initially looking at when those flashes caught my eye in the ne sky. i can't be positive however, but they may have well been sun reflecting off some white geese(which flew over) for all i know.
   i am 52 yrs. old and have always had a curiousity, since about 10 yr. old, about the subject we refer to as ufo's. it wasn't until about 1 1/2  ago that i began an intensive study of ufology. in my quest to learn as much as possible i realized i had to delve into practically every facet of human life, i.E; history,archeology,science,physics,economics, (exo-)politics,biblical,etc. the list goes on.  for each subject i researched there is also someone famous for their discoveries, insights, research on that particular subject, to which is theorized(by some) correlates to an alien visitation that has occurred throughout human history for reasons of exploration, observation and "yes"  perhaps even biological experimentation on us. i believe we have always been observed and not until technology advanced far enough to develope/test the 1st atomic bomb , did they(aliens) begin to make themselves known in our skies near military bases housing bombs.  i believe they have assisted us throughout humanity, steering us away from self destruction with much resistance on our behalf due to hatred and greed.  i also believe that modern world governments/unacknowledged shadow governments and secret societies have had knowledge of unearthly visitors since they were formed and this information is most valueable and sacred, but sightings and visitations have been recorded throughout human existence. 
  i believe world governments are in limbo at this point in time on how to disclose what everyone has always wondered in the back of their minds....Irregardless of the countless witnesses of unquestionable backrounds, in all levels of government, airline pilots, scientists who are willing to testify before  congressional hearings regarding ufo's.  however, disclosure would raise very serious issues on the part of our government that even the old excuse "national security"  wouldn't hold up from a legal standpoint and would likely destroy credibility on the part of the u.S. creating distrust and perhaps chaos among the masses. i believe disemination- an extremely long game of sherades, has been applied to us through ancient art renderings, illustrations, cave drawings/hyroglyphs to modern tv media and books since the 1st discovery of a ufo/occupants by  any world society at any point in history. disclosure will come at a cost, you can believe that.  if it doesn't benefit those in control 100%, disclosure will not come from humans. after all, isn't  that the only evidence you will believe....Your own lying eyes. open your minds, it is the greatest story ever denied....It's the holy grail of humanity.  i only hope i live long enough to bare witness to what would be "revelation" in it's truest sense. a monumental paradigm shift in human history.
content.summary: Bright flashes in the sky like welder's arc over s.E. indiana

content.detailedDescription: My son and i were driving home to dublin from cottonwood baptist church on highway 6 at about 8:30 p.M.  when we got about a mile outside of dublin proper we noticed two blinking lights in the sky.  they were blinking white and blue and were very subtle looking.  then they turned big and bright orange.  they sat there for about 15 seconds then dimmed to the subtle flashing lights again.  then they turned the bright orange again.  but this time just one of the orange lights had a stream of 5 or 6 lights come from it.  then those went out and the orange lights dimmed to the flashing lights again.  they then began to speed across the sky and then more lights showed up.  once again they turned bright orange then dimmed and sped around then brightened again.  sometimes there would just be one light sometimes there would be several . . . as many as 4 or 5.  only one time did i hear a sound from them.  it sounded like a jet had flown by but it came from the lights.  after watching them for about 20 minutes doing this repeatedly i had to leave.  but i came back about 10 minutes later with my son and daughter this time.  we looked for them again but never saw them.  while we were sitting there though two jets flew by at a very high rate of speed and within 5 minutes two more flew by.  i do have pictures but have not been able to download them to my computer yet.  they are still on my iphone.
content.summary: Several blinking objects appeared then burst into larger orange lights then disappeared

content.detailedDescription:
I am a ham radio operator. static comes on radio and then we know it there. its been in the same direction for second group of times for
the second stright year. dogs bark with hair standing on their backs. the light in the sky star like birghter then stars. moves around quickly all directions. i have a couple of trees that it appears behind and can see the movements compaired to the trees. seams to be .5 to 1 mile on the harison.
this time was a little diffrent. two glimering lights (eye like) close to
the grond. they moved acrossed the yard. called my wife out to see and get flash light. wanted to make sure not some kind of animal. turned flash light on the eyes and could see nothing. turn light off and they were there again. they moved to the back of property and went stright up and gone. 3 min later the light that i have seen so many times moved down below tree level and the up an gone. this light looks like a brite star but moves so free. up down left right close and far. not a plan or hele.
makes the hair stand up on the back of my neck also.
content.summary: Light moves all directions zippy like. then flash its gone.

content.detailedDescription: Well, i am not sure where to start. i will start by saying i was interested in ufos since i was about 13. i was pretty familiar with various types of reported ufos before this event happened. so anyway, here we go. i was having thanksgiving dinner at my mothers house about ten years ago. i am not sure exactly what year it was.(i know that sounds sketchy, but i simply do not remember for sure if it was 1999 or 2000) i went outside in the backyard with my brother and a family friend to have a ciggarette. it was a full moon or near one so the small white clouds in the sky were illuminated. my brother and friend were near the backdoor and i had walked about 20 feet away into the yard. for some reason i happend to look up at a cloud just above the left side of the roof of the house from my perspective.(the cloud was about the size of my opended hand held out at arms length) within a second or two i saw what looked like a black line in the middle of the cloud. as i stared at it it droped out of the cloud and rotated so that i could see it was a smokey-black colored triangle with gold lights on the underside of the tips. i should note when it did it seemed to be moving like it was "floating" and made no sound . i would guess it was about the size of a football field considering it was almost the size of the cloud it came thru. it was positioned just under the cloud with the moonlight shining on it. i immediatly recognized it from descriptions on tv programs and became terrified. my mind tried to rationalize it(i thought for a split second it might be a giant hanglider as ridiculous as that sounds) but after about ten seconds i realized what it was. i tried to say something but my brother and friend did not seem to get the point. they were talking to each other and standing under the back porch light. i yelled  at them to get over here. just then the object started moveing from the over the left side of the roof over to the right. as it did, it "blinked" into six or seven gold dics, in triangle formation,the same size as the solid object, but now i could see stars between them. babbling, i ran to my friend, grabbed him by the jacket pulling him to back away from the house so he could see without the porchlight in the way. i pointed as it went behind another cloud. i demanded he tell me what he saw, so i would know i wasnt seeing things. he said he saw gold lights go behind a cloud. this was very important to me. i did not describe it as i was pulling him away from the house. it was my on the spot way of proving it to myself. i ran in the house jabbering about what i saw, while sketching it out with a crayon. i should note, the creepiest thing about it was the way it seemed to be "hideing" behind the clouds. i have never reported this event. i have told friends about it however. i know i cannot prove it, but i know what i saw. for what its worth, seeing this has changed my life and my outlook on the world.
content.summary: Large black triangle with gold lights/ then several gold discs.

content.detailedDescription:
When i was approximately 6 years old, i lived near 136 hickory ln in boone, north carolina. (i just consulted google maps for the location and got that address from there.) my great grandmother, then approximately 78 years old, lived a couple blocks away from my house in a mobile home park, also on hickory ln. i would often walk down and spend the night with her in her trailer on weekend nights.

one evening in either mid-to-late spring or summer (i remember that it was warm weather and the days were longer), i had just arrived at her trailer and she had come outside to greet me, when we both noticed an enormous orange or red-orange ball of fire rolling across the sky to the northwest. it was perfectly round and the size of the sun (maybe slightly smaller), but we had no idea how far away it was. it rolled very slowly across the sky, horizontally from right to left (from northeast to southwest), and was trailing orange flames behind it. the ball was engulfed in flames too and the "rolling" motion was very clear. if my memory serves, we also heard a deep roar coming from it. i remember watching it for as long as we could; it was at least a minute because it rolled very slowly. we were both saying to each other that we had never seen anything like it before and had no idea what it could be. it was eventually out of sight; i can't remember if it disappeared beyond the horizon or behind mountains. the time was near sunset but there was still a good amount of daylight. we were both shocked by the experience and went inside and continued to talk about it and what it could possibly have been.

as the years went by, i remember telling the story many times to other kids at school. when i got older, the sheer strangeness of the event made me wonder if i hadn't just dreamed it. i asked my great grandmother about it in the mid-80s and she immediately recalled the event and remembered it exactly as i did. she is now deceased.
content.summary: Orange, sun-sized sphere rolling slowly across the sky and trailing flames

content.detailedDescription:
After my initial sighting with the object i was interested in knowing more. i made my husband and daughter sleep on the car port on the off chance that we would have a mutually shared sighting. i would stay awake and they would sleep and that was pretty much that.
one late night in early august i got a feeling that i should open my eyes and i didn't want to, but was compelled to...And there it was. 
the night sky above me appeared as normal for that time of year, however, as i looked straight up above there was a big chunk of sky/stars that were missing. instead of the stars above there was what appeared to be a darker than the night black/grey something just moving slowly across the sky, making no sounds and it was huge! i can't say how huge because i had no frame of refernce...Just that it was a darker than the night sky, silent and huge>
i noticed after that, that there were lot's of aircraft whenever i thought, just thought, about this stuff. so i went outside just now and 2 aircrafts were deployed and cruised rt over this house. same thing used to happen when i lived in nm. i have proof that i have been in 2 places at once but also can traverse time in one episode.
content.summary: A large, seemingly dark object of unknown size but appeared to be larger than 3 football fields across. had no reference. just huge!!

content.detailedDescription:
My spouse and i saw some strange lights south/southeast of breckenridge, texas, at 8:30 pm this evening.  the lights were in the direction of eastland but possibly further south.

i spent the last hour before dusk, planting beans and peas in our plowed field.  i had just finished for the day and was standing at the ne corner of the field, with a clear 360 degree view of the sky.

i was observing a few stars barely discernible above me when something made me look to my south.  suddenly a bright white/orange light appeared, then 4 more next to (east of) it.  the four came on all at once.  they all blinked off at the same time.  these lights were approx. 10 degrees above the southern horizon.  they lights only appeared for a few seconds each time.

i ran to the house, yelling for my husband to "come quick, ufos!" (i didn't know what they were at the time, still don't). i grabbed my binoculars and by the time we got to the field, the lights were gone but as we stood there, a light appeared, then 3 more in a loose triangle formation.  they all blinked out at the same time, then slightly further east they all appeared again.  each time they blinked out, they would appear a bit further east until i could no longer see them because of the treeline.

moments later, we saw at least 1 jet flying into that area and it was tiny in comparison to the lights.

after the lights were gone, my husband said, "what is that?" he pointed up at about 65 -70 degrees ese and said, "watch that star, it's moving."  i watched it through the binoculars.  i told him it was probably a satellite but then the object did something that satellites do not do, it altered course from ene to due east and then a few moments later, it disappeared.

i contacted robert powell (mufon) and described what i had seen.  we discussed it and he sent me a video of flares he had taken sometime earlier.  my husband (a military aviation veteran) and i watched the video.  the flares in the video did not resemble what we saw tonight.  my husband is adamant that what we saw were not flares and i do not believe they were either.

evidently we were not the only ones to see these lights tonight.  i have a blog called "lights in the texas sky".  a short while ago, someone posted to my blog what they also saw this evening and it matches very closely to what joe and i saw.

here is their report/comment:

"tonight 3/31/10 around eight thirty pm we saw about 10 flashing lights. it would appear for about 1-3 seconds as a bright orange light, dissapear for about the same time, then come back. but when it reappeared, rather than there only being one there would be multiple. this is about our forth time to see these things and we only see them at night but they are always the same thing. an orange light that flashes a few times then dissapears and we dont see it again the rest of the night." 

if i hear back from the poster, i will send any information to mr. powell.

i am including in this report, 3 depictions of what joe and i saw.

thank you, sw.
content.summary: Several orange/white lights appear, then disappear everal times.

content.detailedDescription: Same thing as my pst from last night except the three lights forming the triangle just dissapeared after about an hour. i took some more pictures i dont exactly no what im looking at because this is not what i was seeing where the green spheres are there were small star like things that were moving about every 5 minuts it was very very noticable and im sure they moved. i dont no how many of them were actually ufo's because it looked like there were other stars like 20 of them thats all i could see i noticed at least 2 of them move(not the ones forming a triangle/upside down pyramid i did not see those move though they did change position in a half hours time, a drastic change of position then when i checked back after like 20 minuts it was gone) the ones i saw move and a phew others seem to be pulsating.
content.summary: Bright lights again

content.detailedDescription: On this date and others days also me and my son were on our way to work and we noticed 2 bright looking stars but they were moving on hwy 257 heading to otwell indiana. i siad wow daniel look those aren't stars they are moving then they were changing colors red, green, blue, flashing lights. i started using my cell phone to zoom in on them and video them and one just in a bright light shot across the sky and was gone. the other in my zoom on my cell phone looked kinda round but oval and changing different colors then in a bright flash it was gone. we still don't know what we were watching but we have seen things like this before on that same road. we also saw a huge orange ball in velpen indiana that we thought was the sun coming up behind the trees but knew that was not what it could be because it was like 11:30 at night time. we first heard a low humming that was getting loud in the house and our dogs went nuts outside and then ran under our trailer. thinking nothing of this i went back in and then heard the humming again outside only louder and went to the door and the orange ball was huge behind the tree line across our yard and you could hear some kind of loud humming noise the orange ball was bigger than a big barn!!!!  it scared us so bad we went in locking doors and then the noise stopped and we finally looked out again and it was gone no where to be found, our neighbors in velpen also witnessed this that night everyone was talking about it. this has been seen by people on more than one occassion there are things out there and we have seen plenty that just can't be explained what it was.
content.summary: Looked like 2 stars at first multi colored.

content.detailedDescription:
I was taking the trash out at 9 30 when i glanced up at the sky as i often do.  i immediately saw 3 rectangle shaped lights moving across the sky. they were orange/yellow in color, and arranged as if they were the bottom of an aircraft. the way they were arranged, with one rectangle atop of 2 other rectangles next to each.  -
                                                 - -  that is how they were arranged.  the craft moved at a consistent speed to the west, where i eventually lost it on the horizon.  the way it disappeared in the sky was much like the space shuttle does as it enters orbit, leading me to believe that this craft was in a low orbit. from the time i noticed the object above me to when i lost sight of it was about 10 seconds. this is something i have never seen before, and leaves me baffled. i was never really a believer in ufo's and dismissed most videos i've seen on tv. this changed my mind, im baffled. i just wish i had time to get it on video.
content.summary: 3 rectangular glowing lights looked to be the underside of a triangle shaped object flew across the sky

content.detailedDescription: Ok this is two nights in a row now. im starting to feel like a broken record here. this time they came on in in a row of 4-5 lights but quickly faded out within' a few seconds. then they came on a 2nd time this time it looked more like a triangle and the lights were all red when it was in the formation of a triangle. if i had to quest i'd say the from each point of the triangle was at least a mile long. so im assuming if my math is correct it had a diameter of 3 miles? not sure if triangles have a diameter but you know what i mean. it was once again the south east of abilene.
content.summary: Two nights in a row of strange amber/red/orange lights

content.detailedDescription:
Monsoon season between late july/august. i was 34/35 (?) yrs old at the time. i was taking care of my daughter and our neighbors children. my daughter was appx. 8/9. the other girls were 13-15 consecutively. we can get more info from the eldest child as she witnessed and reported the craft more thoroughly at the time of the sighting as the others recall no such sighting.
monsoon season is very beautiful and fantastic in the high mountain platueau of new mexico. i lived in an adobe home on a half acre with a direct view of the sandia mountains, a view encompassing the rio grande as well. it was very typical to leave the doors open to the house open during the monsoon season as it cooled off the indoors. my daughter and one of the neighbor children were seated on the brick floor of the house playing a board game when i was attracted to the beautiful lights and colors of the rain/thunder storms so typical of the area at that time of year. the eldest of the children went out front to the patio, which was/is unobstructed from the front room where the children were playing and just stood and watched the beautiful stormy sky. i joined her seconds later and we remarked how "cool" the sky looked. then, to our left, approximately 50 yds above, directly over the t wooden power pole, i saw what looked like a circular object that had a blue neon light at its base. like a round neon light. it made no sound!! it did not vibrate. it did not hum. it was just there.
i understand the value of empirical evidence and so i asked the 15 yr old, "what do you see?" she said, "just what you see." i said, "no, tell me what you see." she said, as the object was still there, that she saw a blue bottomed something and that it was real quiet. something to that effect. i will have her make a seperate statement. anyway, at that time, when we both agreed upon what we saw, it just disappeared or moved away really quickly. we couldn't understand which, it was just gone. there was still storm activity going on and we just looked at each other like, wtf was that.
i have personally tried to not have her recount the episode so that her, at the time, young unbiased mind would not be affected. but there have been other episodes since. as far as sightings. no abductions to my waking knowledge. there have been several as i call them "chevrons, deltas, big huge soundless,slow moving crafts'" over my house in nm.
content.summary: Neon blue light at "bottom" of disc. gray colored above the neon blue.

content.detailedDescription:
We live on a farm not far from hwy 6 and carbon, texas.  my husband and i went out on the patio, facing the west, after dinner around 8:35 pm on wednesday, march 31st. by the way we had lasagna, a salad and water, no alcohol.  i was setting in a rocker facing the southwest, my husband was in a rocker facing the northwest.  i was looking toward our pecan orchard directly to the south of us.  all of a sudden i saw 5 bright amber colored orbs in the sky about 35 degrees above the horizon. they just appeared and stayed on steady and didn't move. they appeared to be overhead and just west of the city of carbon almost 3 miles south of us.  when they appeared it was like they came on in sequence, 1,2 3 4 5, real fast.  the front light would go off as the back light would appear, but always 5 lights stayed on solid in a row. 

i told my husband, "what the hell is that" and when he saw my eyes and heard me he turned his head quickly to the south and he saw them too.  we both got up out of our rockers and headed south into the lawn and stood there for a good minute or so watching these lights.  he said that's not an airplane. i said it's not a meteor show either or a comet or a star.  my mind was trying to process just what this was and if it was anything similar to anything i had ever seen before.   there was no noise.  the adrenilin was flowing and my heart was in my throat.  i had never seen anything like this.  i was scared.  they were moving to the east.  they would disappear for several seconds then reappear a little further east in a different formation almost like if you spread your fingers out on your hand and hold it up to the sky, there would be a large orb at each finger tip.  they were large amber lights in the sky.  they were not blinking lights, just solid lights that would appear and stay on solid, then all would disappear for a few seconds.  they didn't move in a straight line.  each time they appeared they would be at a different level off the horizon from 10 to 35 degrees.

i ran inside to get my camera while my husband stayed in the yard and continued to watch.  while i as inside i called the sheriff's dispatch and reported it and ask if they had an officer in the area to ask him to look to the south toward carbon to see if they could see it. i ran back out side and my husband said they had moved farther to the east and lower on the horizon maybe about 10 degrees.  they looked like they were headed in the direction of stephenville.  we stood there for a good 15 minutes to see if they reappeared but they didn't. sadly, i didn't get my camera in time.  i was too in awe of this thing to leave to go inside and get it.
content.summary: 5 large amber orbs in a horizontal line about 35degrees above the horizon over carbon, tx.  appeared out of nowhere, one after the other in sequence, i.E. 1,2 3 4 5 then stayed on steady, no blinking, then all went out. , then reappeared in diff form .

content.detailedDescription:
At approximately 8:05pm est, i was traveling westbound in my car on fishcreek road in stow ohio. i then observed the object in the sky to the northwest, above a mcdonald's restaurant. at first glance, i thought the object was someone on a motorized paraglider. upon further viewing, it was not a paraglider.

the object appeared to look like a star or cross, and had a mass of something at the junction of where the vertical and horizontal parts met. the object did not appear to be powered and was simply floating northbound. the object did not have any lights or other shiny parts. i was too far away from the object to detect if it made any sound. i am unsure of its elevation, but it was well above the treetops.

after turning right onto darrow rd (rt. 91) i still observed the object moving at a modest speed. i turned left into a mcdonalds parking lot, circled the building, then got back onto darrow rd. to give chase (traveling northbound).

i had the object in sight until i turned left onto terex rd. i traveled approximately 1/4 mile on terex rd. and then made a u-turn heading back towards darrow rd. at that point i could no longer see the object. my last view of the object was at the intersection of darrow rd. and terex rd.

during the entire event i was transfixed by seeing the object and was determined to give chase. i was so excited/confused that i did not think to pull out my iphone to capture a photo or a video.

this object was observed by myself and my 17 year old daughter. i remarked that it looked like something mechanical (like a contraption from the late 19th century).
content.summary: Star or cross shaped object in sky, no lights or power

content.detailedDescription: We were on roundbutte in jefferson co ore, watching stars when a bright "star" appeared in the sky to the nw. it hovered for about 20 mins in a stationary position. there was a tree we could use as a gauge to monitor it's location. all of a sudden it began to move back and forth in an east to west motion. after a few mins, it moved south towards our position. as it came overhead, we got out of the car and watched it. it was very high in the atmosphere and had a triangle outline of lights. no sound came from it. there were other planes in the area and they were totally distinguishable from the triangle object. after it passed over, it headed in an easterly direction. as it moved towards the horizon, it made a "sparkling" display on the rear of the craft and then seemed to contract or shrink into itself and dissapeared. two of us witnessed the event. it was really fasinating!
content.summary: Hovering for 20 mins then flys south and then east

content.detailedDescription: i was driving home from the store at around 6:30 pm. it was very cloudy & dark out, with a storm coming on. as i was driving down highway 204, a bright flash of lightning brightened the whole sky and right in front & above me i saw what looked like a metal object in the sky. there were no lights on it, & it was silver in color. the lightning flash lasted about 2 seconds. after it was dark again, i didn't see anything, but i slowed down to see if i could see it again. lightning flashed again about 30 seconds later, but this time the object was gone. i'm positive about what i saw. it appeared to be cigar shaped, but it could have been a classic disk shape, with the middle being thicker than the ends. because i only saw it briefly, it didn't appear to be moving, just hovering. i didn't hear anything. i believe it was maybe about 1/4 mile away, so it wasn't just a dot in the sky.It seemed pretty big to me. i was shocked. if it was a known aircraft, there would have been lights. i only saw it for about 2 seconds, but that image is burned into my mind.
content.summary: I saw a metal object in the sky during a storm when lightning struck.

content.detailedDescription:
This ufo photo was taken on 29 march 2010 11:54:14 am.  it shows an invisible beige colored worm(?)  shaped object near the cloud. this object came often at night time too. 
please add this attached picture to case 18817 file (long term visitation). more details from: [cms/tg/pid]
content.summary: Worm shaped ufo near the cloud

content.detailedDescription: On the evening of march 30th, 2010 i was going out to dump garbage in the village i live in and a bright light caught my eye to the right of it. the direction was northwest of box elder mt. i didn't exactly think anything of it until i noticed that the object was changing color ranging from red,orange,blue and white. the object seemed to be dropping at a slow pace. it was around 9 o'clock at night when i first noticed it, so i called my brother whom lives across the street from me. i told him to look out and look towards northwest of box elder. my brother and my mom saw the object also and both can give a similar description of what we saw. the object changed colors and also seemed rotate as it was decending downwards. this is a first for me as i never seen a ufo before, but have heard many stories around here. the whole thing took around 40 minutes to happen, the object disappeared suddenly before i can get a picture of it.
content.summary: Star like object changing colors and decended down.
